abstract.text: A rotation angle the connection applies to a video flowing through it.

inlineContent.text: Your app can set a video rotation angle that it gets from an
instance’s
or
property. The rotation angle only applies to video or depth connections, similar to
, and can be any angle that
returns
for.
Not all capture connections rotate each frame. For example, a video connection to an
or
instance applies a rotation with a QuickTime track matrix or with EXIF tags, respectively.
Capture connections to
and
instances rotate video frames they provide to their
and
delegate methods, respectively. Each
instance uses hardware acceleration to rotate every frame.
Avoid potential performance issues by only rotating video with a capture connection when necessary.
You can rotate the video of a movie file you record with an
instance by applying the rotation to an
instance’s
property. This approach avoids the performance costs that come with rotating each video frame.
Your app needs to convert the
or
value from degrees to radians for transform properties.

abstract.text: Work with audiovisual assets, control device cameras, process audio, and configure system audio interactions.
An object that writes media data to a container file.
An object that appends media samples to a track in an asset writer’s output file.
The transform to use for display of the output’s visual media.
An object that represents a connection from a capture input to a capture output.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the connection horizontally flips the video flowing through it.
Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the connection supports a rotation angle.
A rotation angle the connection applies to a video flowing through it.
A capture output that records scene depth information on compatible camera devices.
Provides newly captured depth data to the delegate.
A class that monitors the physical orientation of a capture device and provides adjustment angles to keep images level, relative to gravity.
An angle the coordinator provides your app to apply to photos or videos it captures with the device so that they’re level relative to gravity.
An angle the coordinator provides your app to apply to the preview layer so that it’s level relative to gravity.
A capture output that records video and audio to a QuickTime movie file.
A capture output for still image, Live Photos, and other photography workflows.
A capture output that records video and provides access to video frames for processing.
Notifies the delegate that a new video frame was written.
A true value.
The basic type for all floating-point values.
The basic type for floating-point scalar values in Core Graphics and related frameworks.
